justification_25w: Reducing inequality can improve stability and opportunity though policy design matters
steelman_opposite_25w: Higher taxes can weaken incentives and investment and may slow growth

justification_25w: A welfare state can reduce hardship and improve social mobility if sustainable
steelman_opposite_25w: Large programs can create dependency and strain budgets and growth

justification_25w: Competition often drives innovation efficiency and choice though regulation is needed
steelman_opposite_25w: Markets can fail badly and planning can better handle essentials

justification_25w: Unions can raise wages and safety but can also reduce flexibility
steelman_opposite_25w: Unions may price out jobs and protect insiders over outsiders

justification_25w: Minimum wages help some workers yet effects depend on level and labor market
steelman_opposite_25w: They can reduce hiring and hours especially for low skill workers

justification_25w: Lower corporate taxes may boost investment but can cut revenue for services
steelman_opposite_25w: Higher corporate taxes fund public goods and curb rent seeking

justification_25w: Wealth taxes target extreme concentration yet are hard to administer well
steelman_opposite_25w: They can improve fairness and fund services without burdening workers

justification_25w: Immigration can raise dynamism fill labor gaps and enrich culture if managed
steelman_opposite_25w: It can strain housing services and wages and challenge integration

justification_25w: Rule of law matters but enforcement should be proportional and humane
steelman_opposite_25w: Stricter deportations deter illegal entry and protect public trust

justification_25w: Decriminalization can reduce harm and incarceration while keeping treatment focus
steelman_opposite_25w: It may normalize use and increase addiction and public disorder

justification_25w: Legal access protects bodily autonomy and health especially early in pregnancy
steelman_opposite_25w: Restrictions protect fetal life and encourage alternatives like adoption

justification_25w: Safety is vital but expanded powers risk abuse and unequal enforcement
steelman_opposite_25w: Stronger powers can deter violence and restore order in high crime areas

justification_25w: Clear limits and accountability reduce abuse and build legitimacy
steelman_opposite_25w: Constraints can slow response and reduce effectiveness against dangerous offenders

justification_25w: Tighter regulation can reduce deaths and improve safe storage and tracing
steelman_opposite_25w: Rights and self defense matter and regulation can punish lawful owners

justification_25w: Hate speech limits can protect targeted groups but risk chilling dissent
steelman_opposite_25w: Unrestricted speech enables critique and counterspeech without state overreach

justification_25w: Robust speech rights guard democracy though direct threats should be limited
steelman_opposite_25w: Allowing harmful speech can fuel harassment radicalization and violence

justification_25w: Privacy protects freedom and prevents misuse of collected data
steelman_opposite_25w: Surveillance can prevent attacks and save lives when well governed

justification_25w: Even effective tools can be abused so safeguards and proportionality matter
steelman_opposite_25w: If it truly prevents terrorism the tradeoff can be justified

justification_25w: Mitigation reduces severe future risks and can spur innovation
steelman_opposite_25w: Higher costs can hurt households and industry and provoke backlash

justification_25w: Nuclear offers low carbon firm power though waste and costs are concerns
steelman_opposite_25w: It is expensive slow and risky compared with renewables and storage

justification_25w: Subsidies can accelerate learning curves and deployment for cleaner energy
steelman_opposite_25w: They can waste money and distort signals and entrench favored firms

justification_25w: More regulation can curb monopoly power and improve competition and privacy
steelman_opposite_25w: Overregulation can stifle innovation and entrench incumbents further

justification_25w: Better removal can reduce harm though transparent rules and appeals are needed
steelman_opposite_25w: Overreach can censor legitimate debate and centralize narrative control

justification_25w: Some moderation improves safety and quality though mistakes happen
steelman_opposite_25w: Moderation often becomes biased opaque and politically captured

justification_25w: Guardrails help prevent large scale harms and build trust before rollout
steelman_opposite_25w: Too strict rules can slow beneficial innovation and competitiveness

justification_25w: AI harms like bias and misuse seem more immediate than regulation risks
steelman_opposite_25w: Regulation can entrench big players and chill open research

justification_25w: Deterrence can protect security in a volatile world and support allies
steelman_opposite_25w: More spending can fuel arms races and divert funds from welfare

justification_25w: Aid can save lives and stabilize regions with long term benefits
steelman_opposite_25w: Funds may be wasted or corrupt and should prioritize domestic needs

justification_25w: More integration can solve cross border issues but legitimacy varies
steelman_opposite_25w: Centralization can erode local democracy and one size fits all policy

justification_25w: Subsidiarity matters yet shared power helps collective action
steelman_opposite_25w: Reclaiming powers improves accountability and national policy flexibility

justification_25w: Expert consensus often reflects evidence though values still require politics
steelman_opposite_25w: Experts can be wrong biased or captured so public judgment matters

justification_25w: Majority rule is core but should be tempered by rights and evidence
steelman_opposite_25w: Following experts can ignore democratic legitimacy and lived experience

justification_25w: This is a well established astronomical fact
steelman_opposite_25w: Only a geocentric view would deny it which conflicts with evidence

justification_25w: Paris is the capital city of France
steelman_opposite_25w: If boundaries changed the answer could differ but they have not

justification_25w: Instruction explicitly requests a neutral response
steelman_opposite_25w: Answering differently would fail the stated consistency check
